meanings.definition: People who stand or sit on the ground in a theater.
meanings.sent1: The groundlings enjoyed the play from their spot on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The theater was packed with groundlings watching the performance.
meanings.sent3: The groundlings on the ground had the best view of the stage.
meanings.sent4: The actors interacted with the groundlings, making the experience more immersive.
meanings.sent5: The groundlings felt the vibrations of the actors' footsteps through the floor.

meanings.definition: Common people or the lower class.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the groundlings were portrayed as hardworking individuals.
meanings.sent2: The groundlings in the village were known for their kindness.
meanings.sent3: The groundlings shared a hearty laugh at the simple joke.
meanings.sent4: Despite their struggles, the groundlings stood tall in unity.
meanings.sent5: The groundlings' resilience inspired others in the community.

meanings.definition: Audience members who are not in the upper levels of a theater.
meanings.sent1: The groundlings in the front row cheered loudly at the performance.
meanings.sent2: The theater offered discounted tickets for the groundlings in the lower seats.
meanings.sent3: The groundlings in the balcony envied the view of those below.
meanings.sent4: The spotlight shone on the groundlings, highlighting their excitement.
meanings.sent5: The groundlings' applause filled the theater with energy.
